blocks.data: This is a common *GET* path where more than one allele is expected in the response. One of the example is searching ClinGen Allele Registry using HGNC gene symbols. Please note that the query parameters: gene, dbSNP.rs, ClinVar.VariationId, ClinVar.RCV, MyVariantInfo_hg19.id, ExAC.id, and, gnomAD.id are **mutually exclusive**. You just need to provide one of them for query.

gene.description: Search the allele registry using [HGNC approved gene symbols](https://www.genenames.org/).

dbSNP.rs.description: Search the allele registry using dbSNP rs-Identifier. The rs identifier is an identifier for a location and type of variation. [More information]

ClinVar.VariationId.description: [The ClinVar Variation ID](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/docs/variation_report/) is provided by ClinVar. The Variation ID is a unique identifier for the set of sequence changes that were interpreted (by ClinVar).

ClinVar.RCV.description: [The ClinVar RCV ID ](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/docs/help/)is provided by ClinVar as an accession number that describes a ClinVar submission.

MyVariantInfo_hg19.id.description: Search the allele registry using [MyVariant Identifier](http://docs.myvariant.info/en/latest/). MyVariant identifier for an allele is a simple representation of allele using hg19/GRCh37 reference sequence. The identifier is a variation of HGVS representation to describe variation. Instead of the reference sequence, the identifier uses chromosome name.

MyVariantInfo_hg38.id.description: Search the allele registry using [MyVariant Identifier](http://docs.myvariant.info/en/latest/). MyVariant identifier for an allele is a simple representation of allele using hg38/GRCh38 reference sequence. The identifier is a variation of HGVS representation to describe variation. Instead of the reference sequence, the identifier uses chromosome name.

ExAC.id.description: Search the allele registry using [ExAC Identifier](http://exac.broadinstitute.org/faq). The ExAC identifier for an allele is a simple representation of allele using hg19/GRCh37 reference sequence. The identifier is a concatenated string that describes chromosome, coordinate, reference, and alternate alleles (Chr-Start-Ref-Alt) with "-" delimiter.

c.description: Search the allele registry using [gnomAD Identifier](http://gnomad.broadinstitute.org/faq). The gnomAD identifier for an allele is a simple representation of allele using hg19/GRCh37 reference sequence. The identifier is a concatenated string that describes chromosome, coordinate, reference, and alternate alleles (Chr-Start-Ref-Alt) with "-" delimiter.

skip.description: Number of records to skip in retrieved hits.

limit.description: Limit number of hits to this number

meta.title: Multiple allele queries - /alleles - Reference - Allele Registry API - API Reference
